channel.title: Depression
channel.description: My sister is really depressed. She cries every night And complains she has no friends and she's ugly and that she's fat. All if these are false, but she won't listen to me or anybody else. She says she has contemplated suicide and if it weren't for me she might already have. I am trying everything to cheer her up, but to no avail. Please help me. I hate seeing her like this.

item.title: Depression
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

the wanderer:

I have finally managed to get her a hobby, probably not a good one, but she loves Oblivion. Also thanks to you guys, I know how to handle the situation, when she starts telling me she’s depressed. I don’t look at my sister as being a immature 13 year old, because she is very smart for her age. I don’t mean just grade wise. I mean she can converse with an adult and not look stupid. But I also have opened my eyes a little bit to see that she is indeed only 13. And that I shouldn’t take this as serious. I still take making her feel good serious, but her threats to commit suicide less seriously. You guys have made me understand what depression really is, I never really understood it. And I feel this topic has really hit home at a lot of people on these forums by the looks of it. Thank you all.

Glad to hear shes better

item.title: Depression
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:68, topic:369950”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=466068.msg3423171#msg3423171 date=1291681970]

fuck anti-depressants… cognitive therapy if it comes down to it. shes just gotta pull herself out of it and learn from it and make herself stronger

She could always join the army. I plan to service, my brother is serving our country as we speak. She’ll be doing so much and eating so healthily, she won’t have this problem anymore.
I mean it. It’s not as bad as some people portray it.

Depression is a poor excuse to join the military and risk your life. People who decide on that need to have that thought through, not just go “It will solve this, this, and this.” Joining the military is a serious matter for any family, never something to give yourself an excuse for.

Depression can bring upon thoughts that life lacks meaning. Joining the army>search for meaning>???>find meaning/death/continuation of previous depression
[/quote]
No you join the army because it makes you a stronger person, you help people (gives your life meaning) and makes you a better person over all. The only ones the army kills are those trying to harm others greatly.[/quote]
You have yet to give a good excuse to make it worth looking into when you are in deep depression. You seem to miss the fast, Sergeants will be in your face yelling at you constantly to cause high stress while you are there, so that you are used to it when you are deployed. Does this sound like an ideal place for someone who has considered suicide? I don’t think so Andrew.
